title: BBC Local Live: Beds, Herts & Bucks on Friday, 11 March 2016 - BBC News
summary: a number of extensions and alterations at a house in barton-le-clay must be demolished .
a property thought to be a drugs den has been closed down in luton .
more news , sport , travel and weather from 08:00 on monday .

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: that 's it for this week from the team here at local live for beds , herts and bucks .
we 'll be back at 08:00 on monday with all your news , sports , travel and weather updates .
until then have a great weekend .
author: Alex Pope
BBC Local Live

documents.title: weather : dry with light winds
text: tonight : dry with variable cloud across the county .
lows of -2c ( 30f ) .
there will be some clearer spells , particularly in eastern parts such as watford .
minimum temperature : 1c ( 34f ) .
author: Chris Bell
BBC Look East weather

documents.title: hole suddenly appears in buckinghamshire front garden
text: a seven foot ( 2.1m ) hole has suddenly appeared in the front garden of a family 's home in buckinghamshire .
emma james found the ground caving-in as the front lawn was mown in stoke mandeville .
thames water is coming out to inspect it next week .
author: Adina Campbell
BBC South Today

documents.title: rise in tool thefts from vans in milton keynes
text: van drivers are being advised to make sure their vehicles are secure after a recent rise in thefts of tools from vehicles in milton keynes .
in january there were 23 incidents and 31 in february .

documents.title: a months worth of rainfall fell in bedfordshire in just 12 hours
text: the environment agency says a month 's worth of rain fell in bedfordshire during a 12 hour period on tuesday night and wednesday .
it says the water is now making its way downstream and river levels tshould go down as the forecast into next week is for dry conditions .
author: Alex Pope
BBC Local Live

documents.title: headlines : elderly woman has family heirlooms stolen from graveyard home owner ordered to demolish extension
text: here are the main stories making the news this afternoon :
author: Jane Killick
BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: 'drugs den ' closed in luton
text: a property thought to be a drugs den has been closed down in luton .
bedfordshire police carried out a drugs warrant this morning in raglan close and evidence was found of drugs use and anti-social behaviour .
following an application to luton magistrates ' court , a closure notice for the premises was issued this afternoon .
author: Lee Agnew
BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: milton keynes dons prepare to visit hull
text: mk dons travel to the kc stadium tomorrow knowing a combination of defeat against hull plus rotherham avoiding defeat will mean they could drop into the bottom three in the championship .
victory for the side could take them above fulham and bristol city if those sides fail to win .
midfielder jake forster-caskey is struggling to be fit in time to play .
carl baker is close to a start , but is n't expected to be part of the squad and joe walsh remains on the sidelines .
author: Luke Ashmead
BBC Three Counties Radio sport

documents.title: theft at graveyard 'cruel '
text: police have described the theft of sentimental items from a 78-year-old woman on mother sunday as 'cruel ' .
the family heirlooms including a bank card , keys and mobile phones were stolen from the boot of a car while the victim visited her mothers grave at crownhill crematorium .
pcso gemma gibbs , from thames valley police , said `` the victim was extremely upset and heartbroken '' .
author: Alex Pope
BBC Local Live

documents.title: 'extension ' legal process called 'ridiculous '
text: a bedfordshire man who turned his home into a three-storey mansion says the decision he must demolish the extension within 12 months is 'ridiculous ' .
syeed raza shah was given planning permission to increase the floor space of his house in barton-le-clay , bedfordshire , by about 45 % in 2011 .
he previously described the house , named random house , as an `` eyesore '' when he bought it in 2008 and said he believed his work had improved the property .
author: Kate Williams
BBC Local Live

documents.title: man with links to bedford wanted in connect with attempted murder
text: images have been released of two men police would like to talk to after an attempted murder in reading .
the above left is of q johnson , also known as ricky or jamie sampson , and it 's believed he has links to bedford .
the other man ( right ) has n't been identified , but may be known as diego .
author: Jane Killick
BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: heirlooms stolen from crematorium car park on mothering sunday
text: a woman from milton keynes had family heirlooms stolen while she was laying flowers on her mother 's grave , police said .
the 78-year-old had put a bag into the boot of her car on mothering sunday between 13:45 and 14:10 as she visited crownhill crematorium .
thames valley police said someone smashed the back window and stole the bag , which contained her late mother 's gold pen , rosary beards , a brooch and a necklace .

documents.title: foggy day in luton
text: we love getting your here at local live for beds , herts and bucks .
what you can see above is an image of a rather foggy morning at luton airport from the control tower .
if you 've like to send any to us you can via twitter and email .
author: Alex Pope
BBC Local Live

documents.title: hertfordshire people get busy cleaning for the queen
text: volunteers have been out in force in hemel hempsteadcleaning for the queen .
more than 1,000 residents have got their hands dirty collecting rubbish and sprucing up their neighbourhood over the past few weeks .
scholars of hemel hempstead town football club got involved and you can see all the rubbish they 've collected in the above .
author: Dani Bailey
BBC Local Live

documents.title: weather : dry , cloudy with sunny spells
text: it 'll be cloudy this afternoon , with some bright or sunny spells developing in places .
western parts such as leighton buzzard will see the best of the sunshine .
it will feel slightly cooler than yesterday , although winds will remain light throughout the day .
maximum temperature : 9c ( 48f ) .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: headlines : deadline set for demolition of random house extension cheshunt man to appeal hatton gardens conviction
text: here are the main stories making the news this lunchtime :

documents.title: man suffered severe injuries after falling from mast
text: a man had to be rescued after he fell 20m ( 66f ) from a 30m ( 98f ) telecommunications mast in tingrith , close to toddington .
bedfordshire fire and rescue service were called yesterday and had to bring in special equipment .
they say the man had landed on the roof of a building causing severe injuries .
author: Alex Pope
BBC Local Live

documents.title: mutilated cat found in luton
text: an investigation has been launched after the body of a mutilated cat was found in luton .
police believe it happened on 28 february around whitehall avenue .
officers working with the rspca say the animal was intentionally killed .
author: Alex Pope
BBC Local Live

documents.title: hatton garden burglar carl wood launches appeal
text: a hertfordshire man convicted for his part in the hatton garden burglary has launched an appeal .
carl wood , 59 , from cheshunt , was this week jailed for six years having been found guilty of conspiracy to commit burglary and conspiracy to conceal , convert or transfer criminal property .
author: Jane Killick
BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: greg rutherford out of world indoor championships
text: milton keynes 's long jumper greg rutherford has pulled out of next week 's world indoor championships in portland , america .
the olympic and world champion needs to recover from a chest infection and hamstring injury .
the 29-year-old briton will now concentrate on defending his olympic long jump title in rio this summer .
author: Geoff Doyle
BBC Three Counties Radio sport

documents.title: council warns planned demolition of over extended random house sends out 'clear message '
text: a lengthy process to get the owner of an over extended bedfordshire house to restore it to its previous design and form is now possibly in its final stage .
syed raza shah has 12 months to make the changes to random house in barton-le-clay .
jason longhurst from central bedfordshire council said the decision `` sends a clear message '' that if planning laws are breached the authority will `` apply robust enforcement measures '' .
author: Alex Pope
BBC Local Live

documents.title: random house explained in
text: the owner of random house in barton-le-clay now has 12 months to restore his house to its pre-exising design and form after a decision was made by the planning inspector that building work was unauthorised .
above is a basic outline of what the house looked like originally , the extension plans as approved by the council and what it looks like now .
author: Alex Pope
BBC Local Live

documents.title: man released from car after hitting a tree
text: a man has been released from a car after it struck a tree and turned on it 's side in milton keynes .
firefighters from great holm and bletchley were called this morning to chaffron way in emerson valley .
author: Lee Agnew
BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: police warn people not to remove traffic cones from flooded closed road
text: a warning is being given by bedfordshire police asking people not to remove cones from carlton road in harrold because it is closed due to flooding .
carlton road in # harrold is closed due to flooding .
please do not remove the cones as this could pose a risk

documents.title: order for 'over extended ' house to be demolished welcomed by council
text: a decision taken by the planning inspector meaning unauthorised extensions and alterations made to random house in barton-le-clay must be demolished has been welcome by the local council .
planning inspector diane lewis said `` the differences are substantial when compared to the extension and alteration work approved under the 2011 permission .
accordingly , the 2011 permission was not implemented , but a very different scheme '' .

she added : the current state of affairs is causing serious harm to the green belt and aonb [ area of outstanding natural beauty ] and in the public interest should be remedied as soon as reasonably possibly . ''
author: Alex Pope
BBC Local Live

documents.title: 'extended ' home in bedfordshire , known as random house , must be demolished
text: a bedfordshire man who made controversial extensions and alterations to his house , has been told he will have to demolish them .
central bedfordshire council has fought a lengthy legal battle with syed raza shah , over random house which overlooks the a6 at barton-le-clay .
the council says the decision means mr shah has 12 months to comply and to restore the house to its pre-existing design and form , including removing all the materials from the land .
author: Alex Pope
BBC Local Live

documents.title: breakingdemolition ordered for random house
text: a house in barton-le-clay - known as random house - is to be demolished after a lengthy legal battle .
we 'll bring you more as we get it .

documents.title: concerns raised for missing man
text: police are concerned about a man who 's gone missing from bedford hospital because of his medical condition .
anthony whitehorne , 48 , was last seen in a & e at about 10:40 on thursday morning .
he was last seen wearing a brown cord jacket with a black leather jacket underneath , brown trousers and a woolly hat .
author: Simon Oxley
BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: travel : m1 southbound lanes now open
text: junctions 9-8 on the m1 southbound are now open , but there 's queuing traffic on the m1 southbound between toddington services and j11 a505 dunstable road .
m1 south 9-8 now all open after 4 vehicle rtc earlier this morning .
did you witness ?
call 101 ref 128 pc1810
@ twitterid not driving to the conditions i wonder too close at speed # madness

documents.title: travel : severe holds up at the blackcat roundabout
text: drivers have been stuck at the blackcat roundabout in bedfordshire for over an hour this morning after two accidents .
the a421 great barford bypass in roxton is partially blocked and there 's queuing traffic eastbound .
congestion on the bypass is described as severe .
author: Alex Pope
BBC Local Live

documents.title: police confirm absconded prisoner back in custody
text: thames valley police have confirmed a prisoner who absconded from an open jail has handed himself back in after he disappeared a month ago .
daniel rutter , 43 , who was serving a life sentence for wounding with intent , was last seen at hmp springhill in buckinghamshire on 1 february .
thames valley police said he was back in custody last night .
his case was featured on bbc crimewatch .

documents.title: flood warnings remain in place
text: eight flood warnings remain in place in buckinghamshire - meaning `` immediate action is required '' .
the enivronment agency lists them for the river great ouse and river tove .
the flood warnings continue downstream on the great ouse in bedfordshire .

documents.title: prisoner reported to have handed himself in after crimewatch
text: a prisoner who absconded from springhill open jail in buckinghamshire last month has reportedly handed himself back in after his case featured on bbc crimewatch last night .
police had warned the public not to approach daniel rutter , 43 , who disappeared on 1 february .
crimewatch reported a man claiming to be rutter handed himself in and police were verifying his identity .
thames valley police have yet to comment .
author: Lee Agnew
BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: weather forecast : mist clearing for a dry day
text: dry with sunny spells later as the temperature peaks at 9c ( 48f ) .
east 's elizabeth rizzini has the regional forecast :
visit bbc weather for more .
author: Elizabeth Rizzini
BBC Look East weather

documents.title: headlines : four-year-old boy faced de-radicalisation programme union warns of ticket office cuts
text: the top stories on friday morning :
author: Simon Oxley
BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: welcome to local live for beds , herts and bucks
text: good morning and welcome to the local live page for the three counties - we 'll be here until 18:00 with the latest news , sport , weather , travel and the best of social media .
if you 'd like to get in touch , you can tweet us or email us here .
author: Andrew Woodger
BBC News
